text: Who here lives in Germany and is willing to chat with me? I want to get a feeling for how it would be to live in Germany for a bit. My wife has a German passport and speaks German as her first language (but has never lived there, only been for holiday). I specifically want to find out how tight our budget would be on my current salary (as a worst case single-income scenario) and all the other little things, like is it fun to live there, where should we aim for, how easy will we make friends, what is life like generally etc.

elements.text: Who here lives in Germany and is willing to chat with me? I want to get a feeling for how it would be to live in Germany for a bit. My wife has a German passport and speaks German as her first language (but has never lived there, only been for holiday). I specifically want to find out how tight our budget would be on my current salary (as a worst case single-income scenario) and all the other little things, like is it fun to live there, where should we aim for, how easy will we make friends, what is life like generally etc.

text: Happy to speak with you, but it would have to be tomorrow.

elements.text: Happy to speak with you, but it would have to be tomorrow.

text: To answer your questions it would be helpful to know where you'd want to live

elements.text: To answer your questions it would be helpful to know where you'd want to live

text: Where do you live currently? Have you travelled abroad much?

elements.text: Where do you live currently? Have you travelled abroad much?

text: Thanks, that is part of what I'm trying to figure out

elements.text: Thanks, that is part of what I'm trying to figure out

text: I live in South Africa. I have travelled to Korea, Turkey, and all the neighbouring African countries. But I've never lived somewhere other than in South Africa

elements.text: I live in South Africa. I have travelled to Korea, Turkey, and all the neighbouring African countries. But I've never lived somewhere other than in South Africa

text: Do you speak Afrikaans?

elements.text: Do you speak Afrikaans?

text: Yes Afrikaans is my home language, English is basically native with a tiny bit of an accent left, and my German is not very good. I can basically watch cartoons in German and eavesdrop a little bit on my in-law's conversations

elements.text: Yes Afrikaans is my home language, English is basically native with a tiny bit of an accent left, and my German is not very good. I can basically watch cartoons in German and eavesdrop a little bit on my in-law's conversations

text:
Mostly asking since it's close to Dutch and may be worth exploring too. 

We can set up a call if you'd like and just chat. I'm mostly available during the day with some work meetings in the evening.

elements.text:
Mostly asking since it's close to Dutch and may be worth exploring too. 

We can set up a call if you'd like and just chat. I'm mostly available during the day with some work meetings in the evening.

text: That would be super helpful thanks

elements.text: That would be super helpful thanks

text: Agree that where in Germany is an important question

elements.text: Agree that where in Germany is an important question

text: basically if it's not in the North-West broadly (Northrhine Westphalia, Lower Saxony, Schleswig-Holstein, Bremen/Hamburg), I would advise against it :troll:

elements.text: basically if it's not in the North-West broadly (Northrhine Westphalia, Lower Saxony, Schleswig-Holstein, Bremen/Hamburg), I would advise against it

text: Hahaha - so just the boring parts? ;)

elements.text: Hahaha - so just the boring parts? ;)

text: Tomorrow is a bit of a busy day for me, but we are available for calls from 18h00 (GMT+2) to late

elements.text: Tomorrow is a bit of a busy day for me, but we are available for calls from 18h00 (GMT+2) to late

text: And I'll start bouncing idea's around with my wife to zone-in a bit more location wise

elements.text: And I'll start bouncing idea's around with my wife to zone-in a bit more location wise

text: I can do 6pm tomorrow.

elements.text: I can do 6pm tomorrow.

text: Thanks Fabian, really looking forward

elements.text: Thanks Fabian, really looking forward

text: You could set up a <http://jit.si|jit.si> instance that people can join - we've got quite a few Germans around, as well as Germans living abroad (although I'm not aware of Germans in SA!) so there's a healthy diversity of opinions I'd imagine

text: Good Idea Nils

elements.text: Good Idea Nils

text: I'll post the jit se link 6pm tomorrow then others can join our chat

elements.text: I'll post the jit se link 6pm tomorrow then others can join our chat

text: I’m also very interested in this topic as well. I’m a Canadian that recently gained Austrian citizenship and my wife and I would like to move to Europe for a couple years. Germany is definitely on the table, so I’m curious to hear what people have to say

elements.text: I’m also very interested in this topic as well. I’m a Canadian that recently gained Austrian citizenship and my wife and I would like to move to Europe for a couple years. Germany is definitely on the table, so I’m curious to hear what people have to say

text: Yes please come join if you can, would be nice to have others with the same questions and aims

elements.text: Yes please come join if you can, would be nice to have others with the same questions and aims

text: 6pm in what time zone?

elements.text: 6pm in what time zone?

text: GMT+2

elements.text: GMT+2

text: I'm a German currently living abroad, but originally from North Rhine-Westphalia (very western part of Germany). I wouldn't necessarily advice against moving to that part of Germany. :wink: Feel free to contact me as well if you want to hear another opinion. :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: I'm a German currently living abroad, but originally from North Rhine-Westphalia (very western part of Germany). I wouldn't necessarily advice against moving to that part of Germany.
Feel free to contact me as well if you want to hear another opinion.

text: To be clear: I was (mostly) joking about not moving there. Lived in Paderborn for a few years and I have family near the dutch border.

elements.text: To be clear: I was (mostly) joking about not moving there. Lived in Paderborn for a few years and I have family near the dutch border.
